data.title: Very good
data.text: Stopped in while in Yakima. Cute place with awesome family very good service and the food was delicious

data.title: Maybe just short of a 5 rating
data.text: The food quality at the lunch buffet was way above average.  The only issue was limited selection.  Given the small area available, perhaps this was the best they could do.  Recommend without hesitation.

data.title: Great food
data.text: We were passing through Yakima on a road trip from Texas to northern Washington. We had a taste for pad Thai. I was apprehensive about stopping in a mostly Mexican cuisine town (same problem in Texas) for Thai food. It was much to my surprise that this was some of the best Thai food I had ever had. Clean restaurant great service and best of all the food was outstanding. This will always be one of my stops through Yakima.

data.title: Authentic Thai food
data.text: It was very good fresh authentic Thai food! We went for lunch using trip advisor and sure the food was delicious! We met the owner and chef of this place. She is very pleasant women who knows how to cook!

data.title: Outstanding flavors and heat
data.text: Excellent serving of Three Flavors, a house speciality, which was a healthy and tasty dish. Featuring beef, chicken, and prawns with red and green peppers, bamboo and carrots, in a sauce, it was a big enough serving for two. It isn't served with rice, so added a side of sticky rice to help soak up the delicious sauce. I asked for medium spicy and it was just right. When I finished, my lips were pleasantly burning! The only detractor from the meal is that the restaurant doesn't have a liquor license and I really could've used a beer to offset the spicy heat! Service was a smidge uneven, but it was not a deal breaker. Convenient location to convention center. Appropriate destination for singles, couples, families and it looked as it there may have been enough space in the back for large parties. I was here for dinner but they also have a lunch buffet. I'd come back for more when in town again.

data.title: Amazing food!
data.text: The Thai House is a small place that has changed hands many times. The current ownership/management has done amazing things with this location. The food is delicious. Everything tastes fresh. I've eaten here three times and every time I have been pleased with the meal. Over the lunch hour, they have a buffet with excellent options. Other times their menu is clear, affordable and delicious. This is my new favorite restaurant.

data.title: Best Thai Evet
data.text: Had the opportunity for a take out order from Thai House restaurant. Order was complete, hot and every item was detailed and marked. Quality of ingredients was Superior, very fresh and authentic. Be sure and order the Tom- kha soup, and black rice pudding. The cook was excellent and very gracious. The order was also very Timely and all items were there. I will definitely order again and take the opportunity of dining in. Facility was extremely clean and welcoming.

data.title: NICE LITTLE GEM
data.text: Excellent authentic Thai restaurant. Curry was very good. The owner has years of experience from Thailand and in other countries. She is very gracious. Yakima your lucky and you should appreciate a quality restaurant with one of the world best cuisines.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Had lunch buffet. Reasonable price. Fresh buffet, Consistently replaced. Nice but t quiet service. Jasmine tee was fresh but needed to ask for ice cup.

data.title: So glad this place opened up in Yakima!
data.text: Best Thai food in Yakima by a long shot! So glad this place opened up. Noodle dishes are pretty good, rice dishes also pretty good. Excited to try some of their curry soon

data.title: Fresh Ingredients, delicious food
data.text:
I've eaten at this restaurant a number of times and always really enjoy it.  Super fresh ingredients and great flavor combinations.  The Tom-Kha soup is absolutely delicious.  I also love the Orange Chicken.  The only downside is that dishes tend to come out one-at-a-time.  The upside is that each dish is prepared carefully.  Overall, this is by far the best Thai restaurant in the area.

Note: The ownership changed hands recently so the name of the restaurant may now be 'Thai Garden' instead of 'Thai House'.  My review is based on the new ownership.

data.title: Fresh herbs, fresh food
data.text:
I intend this to be the Thai restaurant at 14 N 2nd St, Yakima, WA. It recently changed owners, and maybe names.

I really liked this place. Good food. Fresh seasoning.

Lunch buffet is good eating and a good value.

Night time menu provides excellent food.
